note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal (Bibliothèque nationale de France), 3338
Gothic, written in 2 columns of 40 lines, 1 scribe, 2 pen-flourishers
2 artists, Jeanne de Montbaston (quires 1-4) and Mauberge Master (quires 7-9, 13) (this is according to Rouse and Rouse, see bibliography)

1 double-column panel miniature in colors and gold and a 3-sided foliate bar border with six roundels containing busts (f. 1r). 36 single-column panel miniatures with architectural frames (2r, 2v (x3), 3r, 3v, 4r, 4v, 5r, 5v, 7r, 8r, 11v, 13r, 15r, 15v, 20v, 21r, 21v, 22r, 23r, 24r, 25r, 25v, 26r, 28r, 29v, 30v, 50v, 64r, 68v, 99v, 100v, 102v, 104r). Many of the miniatures are now damaged. Champie initials in pink and blue on gold ground follow miniatures. Smaller blue initials flourished in red and red initials flourished in blue throughout.
310 x 230 mm (this measurement is from Langlois)
French; brown calf binding, raised spine bands, gilt ornaments on spine, title in gilt on spine, marbled endpapers.
Bibliothèque de Paulmy, late 18th century; Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, 19th century (after 1797).
Notes about the poem are written on frontmatter.flyleaf.02r, f. 29v and f. 146r in an 18th-century hand. Also on f. 146r there are some lines of Petrarch in a 16th-century hand.
1. Henry Martin, Catalogue des manuscrits de la bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, III, p. 337
3. Richard H. and Mary A. Rouse, Manuscripts and their makers: commercial book producers in medieval Paris, 1200-1500 (Turnhout: Harvey Miller, 2000) II, pp. 177, 204
